name: The Balmoral Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from the Balmoral Hotel after spending the weekend celebrating our wedding anniversary.
reviews.title: Excellent service, and great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to the hotel and we would thoroughly recommend a stay there. The directions on the website made it really easy to find and we were really impressed with the frontage of the hotel, as it blended in well with what is obviously a residential street.
reviews.title: Ideal location large warm rooms excellent restaurant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On entering, the hotel reception were very welcoming and took the time to show us to our room (2) and explain the facilities. The decor was "shabby chic" and spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: Epicurian Delights and Luxurious Nights.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We dined out on the first evening, but spent some time in the hotel bar. The christmas decorations were just enough, and the atmosphere in the bar was welcoming. The service was attentive, and personal and the manager was very much in evidence which was great to see.
reviews.title: Don't believe all the negative comments...perfect place for a romantic getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We dined in the restaurant on our last evening. We both chose from the Christmas menu, £24.00 for 3 courses. It represented fantastic value for money. The dishes were innovative and carefully presented by the restaurant team who were faultless in their service. The Longhorn Beef Wellington was moist and melt in the mouth, and the brie trifle for dessert was an unexpected twist on the classic cheese course. Three courses and a bottle of wine - £63.00, fantastic value and service that would not be out of place in a Michellin starred restaurant. The experience made us feel totally spoiled and very VIP.
reviews.title: Good value in Harrogate!
"recently refurbished" erm, when was that then?!!!!
reviews.text: the hotels main website advertises this hotel as "fully refurbished to a luxurious standard" and in the rooms overview section it states all the rooms as being "recently refurbished".

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: great, a lovely newly done out luxury boutique hotel, perfect for a surprise to celebrate my partners birthday, so i booked a mini suite..
reviews.title: Mildly disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: recently eh, not quite as recent as i thought!! our room (the highgrove suite) boasted torn furnishings, chipped and flaky paintwork, a lovely collection of cobwebs, grime along the bath edge and an abundance of muck in the window frames!
reviews.title: Excellent choice, clean, friendly and super rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i'd call it shabby and in need of a holly good spring clean.
reviews.title: Not as posh as you'd think, but still good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the paintwork in the restaurant was grubby too, and although i can't fault the quality of the food, more/better options on the dinner package would have been nice.
reviews.title: Disappointing,below expected standard.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We booked for one night, during the first week in December, for our annual Christmas shopping trip. It happened to be a few days after Harrogate fell under 12inches of snow, which made the whole experience even more cosy.
reviews.title: Perfect Pre Christmas shopping trip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: When we arrived at the hotel, we were told that we'd been upgraded from the mini suite we'd booked, and were led into the Windsor suite, which is on the ground floor, next to reception. The room is beautiful! a very large Baroque style series of rooms - large living room, with pretty living flame gas fire (feels real when its on), Kingsize bedroom, dressing room, huge bathroom with double end pedestal bath tub & separate shower.
reviews.title: A fantastic hotel - will be back and recommend it to anyone!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a full day shopping, we returned to our suite, and as we were travelling with our 18 month old son, we settled him in the cot in the bedroom (which the hotel provided), cranked up the fire, opened a bottle of wine and ordered room service. we couldn't have had a better night if we'd have eaten out in Harrogate's best restaurant. It was just what the doctor ordered and a real home-from-home.
reviews.title: Excellent Service & Facilities @ Balmoral

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was ample the next morning and all of the staff were polite and helpful. The hotel is clean and well maintained. The decoration is stylish and elegant and the whole experience is delightful. Id recommend this hotel to anybody who wants to stay within walking distance of harrogate but is looking for something a little more luxurious than the travel lodge.
reviews.title: Nice location, shame about lack of `service with a smile'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Highly recommended!
reviews.title: A nice friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: This is old school 5-star. We first had chosen another hotel. Trendy, boutique and out of town. Was fiully booked. All the best: because the Balmoral is a great option. Old-school palace, at the heart of the city, next to central station. One of the city's landmarks, with its clock tower. You arrive: the tartan-clad doorman is impeccable. Be warned: there are a few details here that you might not like in the first place, e.g. the skinny bunches of flowers in the lobby, the worn carpets or pieces of furniture here and there or also the unpleasant smell of fuel in some corridors. Luckily, this is immediately balanced by this hotel's best feature: a perfect service. Ever-present, friendly, resoectful, efficient. We had a superior room in 3rdc floor facing the Castle. Very large, very high ceiling, great view, Conran-style sober, perfect room design, Carrara marble bathroom: great! One enormous fault here: the sound-proofing. The windows are not properly insulated so you may hear the outside noise. Hard to understand in a newly refurbished hotel! We were lucky because our room was far enough from the main street, but this should be addressed, absolutely! The rest is only praise: classy in-room breakfast (prefer that to the buffet, too crowdy and cafeteria-like), gorgeous pool and spa, top notch one-star Michelin restaurant (The One), perfection in details ( "ren" amenities, shined-shoes wrapped in silk-paper, etc). So, definitely a place to remember. Just ask them to re-do the rooms' sound-proofing! Uh and also: we loved the compllimentary botttle of Champagne (part of our package), but next time know that we'd appreciate a half-botttle of great Champ rather than a full one of cheap bubbly. Looking forward to coming back!
reviews.title: Old school, good school.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel looked like an opulent dream for my Hogmany trip this past Dec/Jan, but when we arrived, the entrance was small, Christmas decor mediocre, and just no wow factor. The staff did not go out of their way, EXCEPT for the porter on our last day, on our trip to train station. HE WAS EXCEPTIONAL, but that was the only 5 star treatment we got on our trip. The rooms were nice and large, and the bathroom was awesome: white, new, clean. But the hotel itself is just not what it should be. The bar, which was written up as a 5 star luxury experience with dress code, etc, has OLD, torn banquettes with cheap tables and bad lighting! I was stunned! Looked like a diner. We went for drinks at the adjacent sitting lounge and there was ONE waiter on duty who was running all over not even trying to hide how over worked he was. He said because it's a holiday they are short staff. Great time to not staff your hotel. Not plush or regal. I would look into a boutique hotel if you are considering Edinburgh.
reviews.title: questionable luxury at The Balmoral

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the Balmoral as we had planned a weekend in Edinburgh to look at wedding venues which we had planned for ages and were very much looking forward to. I have stayed at the Balmoral before and had always had a good experience.
reviews.title: Fantastic but spoilt by rude receptionist

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: The welcome from Concierge was warm and they immediately parked the car and emptied the car of luggage. However the receptionist was rude and very difficult to deal with. I had booked a double room and was prepared to upgrade as we wanted to make the stay extra special with a castle view room. The attitude was appalling and after paying a significant amount extra, there was still nothing pleasant about the experience. I felt embarrassed at how she was dealing with me and it damped the high spirits which we were both in.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, perfect base to explore the city.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Balmoral never even offered to show us around the Hotel as a possible wedding venue and after the negative experience at the desk this really did not set a good example of the service offered.
reviews.title: Product didn't match the billing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Maybe it was just the two days we we stayed there last week, but the staff seemed frenzied and the level of service was not what we expected from a Rocco Forte hotel. We were in a room on the fifth floor with a window view of the castle, which was quite spectacular. While the furnishings were fine, recognize that it is an older hotel, so you will find some normal wear and tear. But we were unable to get the WiFi to work acceptably in our room - and unfortunately that is critical now as everyone has mobile devices and if you are traveling internationally, you don't want to eat up local OTA minutes as they are too expensive. I had to head down to the lobby to get adequate signal strength just to send and receive email. It was the sending of email which was so painfully slow. The hotel did agree to reverse the charges for the WiFi, which was appreciated.
reviews.title: Service was just OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Be careful using the phone though. I had to call British Air assuming that i was calling a local 800 number. But it was BA's customer contact number which has an 844 prefix. The hotel charged us 32 GBP for the call . Should have used Skype but that was not possible since the WiFi was not working!
reviews.title: A very beautiful and fancy hotel
5 Star all the way !!!
reviews.text: The concierge was helpful to an extent, but not really up on what cultural activities are going on in town (he had to spend time scrolling through a online database to see what might be available). Maybe it was just a quiet time in Edingburgh - after the Festival in August? So we had two quiet evenings in the city.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: They have two restaurants - one Michelin rated which we did not try but which is located on a lower level of the hotel. And the other is called La Belle Epoque, which is where they serve breakfast, lunch and dinner. Breakfasts were frenetic. There appeared to be a modest sized conference in the hotel while we were there - possibly a Russian group based on the signage i saw. In any event, the breakfasts were far from comfortable with people rushing about and the help not able to stay on top of what the needs of the guests were. The food choices are fine, but it is a buffet and the a la carte items are not particularly enticing. We also had dinner there one night and it was fine, although the server was again quite distracted. We found much better dining options outside the hotel, particularly in the New Town area.
reviews.title: Love!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The doorman was probably the worst aspect of the trip, in not helping us with our bags, either when we arrived or when we departed.
reviews.title: Prepare to become Royalty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Balmoral is a 10 minute stroll from the very pleasant Harrogate town centre. An older Victorian terraced property it has clearly had some recent investment to bring it up, overall, to a very good standard within the structural limitations (creaky floors for one) of an older property. A pleasant bar and brasserie has been fashioned on the ground floor where good food is well served.
reviews.title: Sold short

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the more puzzling then, that the management should sell a room that clearly isn't what it purported to be. A late booking for a popular weekend secured the last "standard" room. This proved to be very, very small. Even worse, in order to make the room look reasonable a very small double bed had been installed. Unwisely, we stayed. A poor night's sleep resulted, Reception next morning admitted this was "one of their smallest rooms" and offered a reduction in the bill - declined - but it says to me that the management know they are selling a substandard product.
reviews.title: Elegant, Boutique Hotel, Superb Facilities, within 10mins of all local amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you must stay at the Balmoral ( and I wouldn't again because of what I feel is dishonest selling) then avoid "standard" rooms like the plague.
reviews.title: Beautiful room, great decor, good service, perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great shame that the management has taken this shortcut as, otherwise, they have a very decent hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful room with excellent service, and gorgeous food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we first enquired about this room it was priced at £190.00 per night, but after a "shy kids get nothing email" we were offered and booked, at a discount rate of £120.00 B&B for the fabulous "Clarence" Suite. (We looked again and saw this reduced in price again, to £109.00 the day before our booking of 7/2/11 but were told the £120.00 was the best price they could offer which was still a brilliant price imo)
reviews.title: Fabulous amazing food and excellent service made a memorable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. It is expensive (£220 for each room) but not great for the monay. The staff are very helpful and attentive and I guess thats what you pay for. The room was tidy and had a great view over the Bridge. The houesekeeper wasa the only Scot amongst the staff I came across but as I said they were all Customer focused. Very good location - right on Princess Street. Be aware though that there is no parking. I had to go and park a 10 minute walk away at the bottom of the Royal Mile (£23 for 2 days). Letting someone off at the door is difficult due to the roadworks currently going on. Breakfast included a 10 minute wiat to be seated and the hot grills were lukewarm.
reviews.title: Expensive but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sorry for being negative but overall - average for the money. Expected more somehow...
reviews.title: Super!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: True luxury....beautiful rooms, amazing swimming pool..great food and very centrally located. The room was available for early check in and was very clean. The lobby area is very pleasant. The bathroom was very spacious and clean. Would definitely visit again.
reviews.title: Perfect Afternoon Tea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We spent a rainy afternoon enjoying afternoon tea at the Balmoral and it was just perfect. The staff are wonderful (totally easy about taking our photos for us!) and the food and tea were great. There was a harpist playing the whole time, so it's just a lovely, relaxing way to spend the day.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel with fabulous service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: They were also great about catering for me as a vegetarian, too. Highly recommended for a perfect Scottish Tea.
reviews.title: Unexcelled service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: For this kind of ££££, I expect to have everything. Balmoral offered lots of luxuries but failed on a few of the basics
reviews.title: Luxury? Yes. Basics? No.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Luxuries....
reviews.title: Feel like Royalty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Grand lobby & staff greet us & immediately we are treated like royalty. Rooms are super-incredibly plush w/ huge cathedral ceilings & overstuffed beds & chairs. Bathrooms are equally push & the shower was one of the best I've ever had.....water pressure is spot on, temp is fantastic & the products are luxuriantly smelly
reviews.title: Unexpected stay at the Balmoral

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The concierge desk was fantastic & secured rezzies at various "already fully booked" restaurants & had a recommendation for just about everything
reviews.title: So near yet so far.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Location also can't be beat - situated right in the heart of Edinburgh, this hotel is w/in easy walking distance to all the touristy hot-spots. There's also a plethora of taxis available to take people on short jaunts - as my parents have limited mobility we super-appreciated the hotel arranging taxi support.
reviews.title: The refit has taken away its charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: This hotel is ideally located close to the George street and the shops and also very close to the Royal Mile. However, the flip side to its location is that Princess St is a very busy street quite noisy.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, old hotel
Great Hotel
reviews.text: I would say that it is a very beautiful hotel but I found the furniture to be very old. Rooms are large, very clean and well equiped but very impersonal. Probably expensive for what you get. The bathroom was very big and nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a fine restaurant at the hotel, Hadrians, which I would recommend. Breakfast buffet there is quite generous and good.
reviews.title: Undoubtedly first class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: In brief, I guess it was just ok.
reviews.title: OK, but needs to be refurbished

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Excellent hotel: room, service, locación, everything is fiesta quality. So, basically only good comments. Just a little disappointed because I intended for the "stay more for less" but was not possible and I think internet access should be free.
reviews.title: First Class Hotel in Edinburgh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Had a great stay . Thought it good value given it's location, style. Pleasant professional staff. Very nice room, well appointed, large bath. Great location. Highly recommended. Only complaint is the internet charges which they should drop.
reviews.title: First Class Service and Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: What a shame.I was expecting so much from this Hotel.The sandwiches were served with no thought to presentation just a few crisps thrown on top .The cakes were reasonable.Just one small cup of coffee was served with no offer of a refill .It was not worth the cost .
reviews.title: Afternoon Tea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I first experienced the Balmoral when invited to a business function there. We were suitably impressed and so I booked to celebrate our anniversary with a gourmet meal on the evening in the Number One restaurant. From the moment of arrival our every need was catered for, from the parking of our car to the excellent service in the restaurant. We received an upgrade to a suite with a view of Princess Street. The only negative point would be that there was no ironing board in the room but this was provided on request. Many of the staff wished us a happy anniversary and all were friendly and helpful. John on the door is a great character. Perfectly located at the North Bridge end of Princess Street this is the hotel to book when staying in Edinburgh. We had delightful stay and we have every intention of returning when we next stay in this city.
reviews.title: Balmoral Hotel Edinburgh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights in a deluxe room, which was very spacious and had lots of wardrobe space.
reviews.title: Could have been better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was no tea or coffee making facilities in the room and you have too ask reception and they will deliver a tray free of charge.
reviews.title: Excellent!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Went to meet a cousin in Edinburgh while away with a group of family and friends. Arranged to meet in the hotel so we thought we would go for breakfast but when we got there the restaurant was full but they showed us to a beautiful lounge where we were able to have coffees. Our cases where taken and looked after and as we were leaving they asked if we had enjoyed our visit and we said we had come for breakfast but had been to late They said to leave our cases while we went and found somewhere else to eat. That was a great help to us. It was a lovely way to finish a trip to Edinburgh
reviews.title: Warm Welcome
Expensive but an amazing hotel building
reviews.text: Lovely building in the centre of Edinburgh. It's an event staying in this hotel. It's beautifully decorated and the rooms have very comfortable beds. The bathroom floor was cold as tiled with no heating but standing on a towel sorts that. Only shame was no ironing board or coffee making facilities in the room. It's not cheap but is lovely.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I stayted here for two nights with a couple of friends. This was a treat as we had been friends for a long time and every couple of years we book somewhere lovely for a couple of nights. Having experienced a few spas we thought we would opt for a more city break with a spa should we want it. The Balmoral is a 5* hotel and therefore not a cheap option and one would expect exceptional customer service, sadly I have to say this was lacking in some areas.
reviews.title: The Balmoral

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Firstly the booking experience left a lot to be desired. As we wanted a room for three adults this could not be completed on line which is fine, they do have a very good service (or rather the Rocco Forte group which it belongs to do) which involves them ringing you immediately you register your wish to book. You would think that having a conversation with a real live person and explaining your need for 3 adults with 3 beds would not be so hard, also having confirmation that breakfast was included - not so. Within minutes of making the booking I had email confirmation for 2 adults and 1 child and no breakfast. I should have known it would go wrong when the reservation agent tried to book me for 3 nights and not 2 (although we should have gone for 3 as it would have been cheaper). There then followed an email exchange with the hotel who were reluctant to honour the booking I had made and wanted to charge me more to upgrade the room to accomodate another adult. This they then agreed to honour but there was yet a further discussion on breakfast. This rather put a dampner on the start of our break.
reviews.title: Bit of a do

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is lovely and has a fabulous position right by the train station so you dont have far to walk if arriving by train and we had no disruption from the trains at all.
reviews.title: Aromatherapy Massage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Balmoral is Scottish hospitality at its best, unobtrusive service, thoughtful touches, luxury fabrics and classic design. The rooms are fabulously done, spacious and clean. Nothing is too much trouble, from booking into the spa, to ordering late night tea and shortbread to afternoon tea.
reviews.title: Scottish hospitality at its classic best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: The only wrinkle was that I had pre-paid my room and I had to insist at the front desk that this was the case as the clerk tried to charge me twice and did not believe me at first when I protested. I do think that the breakfast menu would be enhanced by kedgeree but the smoked salmon and scrambled eggs were a great second choice. THE place to stay in Edinburgh.
reviews.title: Love the place, it's a must stay, if you like great staff, food and rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 6th or 7th stay and again The Balmoral never fails to deliver, service 10/10, staff 11/10, rooms one of the comfiest beds ever, you don't want to get up and could easily miss breakfast. Breakfast is top class, food great, and service again great, a young man from India served us, he is a asset to the hotel, friendly, chatty and pleasant, thank you. Looking forward to our next stay, ps afternoon tea is fantastic!!!!!
reviews.title: The Balmoral, Edinburgh - excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic location for a luxury weekend break, right on the doorstep of the Waverley station. Standard room was a good size and very comfortable, with excellent bathroom. We did not breakfast in the hotel but did dine in the Michelin-starred restaurant, which was a good standard although provided small portions which left us still hungry after a very expensive meal! Staff were very good although nothing special - rather impersonal. Leisure facilities were of high standard but under-publicised in the website so many guests would be unaware of the extent of facilities available. A downside was the extremely high drinks prices,which put us off staying in the hotel, and the overcrowding of the bar with non-residents using this as a waiting stop for their trains. There was minimal lounge seating away from the bar.
reviews.title: wow, fantastic place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed in March 2013, what a great place, for such a large hotel, the staff were attentive to each detail, from check in to check out we were treated like royalty. Its probably a bit too expensive for us to become regulars, but if ever we win the lottery....
reviews.title: The Balmoral Hotel, Edinborough - romantic!

description: Rocco Forte Hotels' Balmoral is a luxury hotel in the true sense of the word. With its majestic clock tower, the hotel is a unique and contemporary luxury five-star property in the very heart of Edinburgh. While many Edinburgh hotels claim to have Edinburgh's landmarks on their doorstep, few can say their doorstep is a landmark. Located on Princes Street, in Edinburgh's main shopping area and next to Waverley Station, The Balmoral is close to the leading luxury department stores and within walking distance of many Edinburgh attractions.Edinburgh International Airport is just 25 minutes by car from the hotel, and its convenient location makes The Balmoral the ideal luxury hotel in Edinburgh for business or leisure, including the famous Edinburgh Festival and Hogmanay. There are also convenient transport links also from Glasgow or Prestwick Airports.The Balmoral offers 188 opulent suites and stylish rooms, many with views towards Edinburgh Castle and the Old Town. The Balmoral’s ten conference and banqueting suites, including the signature Sir Walter Scott Suite all enjoy natural daylight and can accommodate a wide range of events including: business conferences, intimate dinner parties, large receptions and weddings. The hotel and city also make for an ideal incentive destination with an abundance of history and culture readily available.When it comes to fine-dining, the choice of restaurants at The Balmoral matches the mood of the moment. With attentive but non-intrusive service, guests can choose from the hotel's Michelin-starred number one fine dining restaurant with outstanding cuisine provided by Chef Jeff Bland; Hadrian's for chic and informal dining; Palm Court for traditional afternoon tea or its very own Bollinger Bar. The newly refurbished and stylish Balmoral Bar is perfect for a relaxing cocktail or traditional whisky.For the ultimate in relaxation, the Balmoral Spa is an exclusive retreat in the heart of the city offering five treatment rooms with ESPA treatments, a 15 metre swimming pool, sauna, steam room, gymnasium and exercise studio. The Balmoral is the perfect choice for a luxurious city spa break.The Balmoral was named as the top Scottish hotel in the Telegraph Travel Awards 2012 and as the Top UK Business Hotel outside of London at the Condé Nast Traveler’s Readers’ Travel Awards 2012. Be it for a luxury romantic break or important business meeting; make The Balmoral your address in Edinburgh.
